data.text:
She was called the “Hungarian child” and was her mother’s favorite. Yet she has remained fairly unknown. With this blog I introduce her to you: Marie Valerie …

Youth

Archduchess Marie Valerie, born on April 22, 1868, was the fourth and youngest child of Emperor Franz Joseph I of Austria and Empress Elisabeth (Sisi). Grandmother Sophie had been very involved in the education of the first three children. This was not the case this time. Marie Valerie was born in Budapest, a year after the coronation of her parents. There were rumors that she was not the daughter of Frans Jozef, but of Count Gyula Andrássyde. Unfairly, especially when you see how much she resembled her father.

Marie Valerie was Sisi’s favorite child. She spent a large part of her childhood with her mother in Hungary, giving her the nickname “the Hungarian child” in Austria. When she grew older, she increasingly distanced herself from everything that was Hungarian.

Wedding

As a daughter of the emperor, she received many marriage requests. Eventually Marie Valerie got to know Archduke Franz Salvator of Austria on a ball in 1886, and fell in love. People had hoped better for her, but she chose love. They became engaged in 1888 and the marriage took place on 31 July 1890 in the village church of Ischl.

The couple settled bought Schloss Wallsee, on the Danube, in 1895. After a thorough renovation, the family of Marie Valerie moved into the castle

in 1897. Unfortunately, the marriage did not appear to be happy. Over the years, French Salvator increasingly had extramarital relationships, to the great sorrow of Marie Valerie.

Children

Marie Valerie and FranzSalvator had ten children together:

Elisabeth Franziska (1892-1930)

married Count Georg of Waldburg-Zeil-Trauchburg

Franz Karl Salvator (1893-1918)

Hubert Salvator (1894-1971)

married Princess Rosemary of Salm-Salm

Hedwig (1896-1970)

married Count Bernard of Stolberg-Stolberg

Theodor Salvator (1899-1978)

married Countess Maria Theresa of Waldburg-Zeil-Trauchburg

Gertrud (1900-1962)

married Count Georg of Waldburg-Zeil-Trauchburg, widower of her sister Elisabeth

Maria Elisabeth (1901-1936)

died unmarried

Clemens Salvator (1904-1974)

married Countess Elisabeth Rességuier de Miremont

Mathilde (1906-1991)

married Ernst Hefel

Agnes (1911, died after her birth)

Dramas

In 1889, Marie Valerie lost her brother Rudolf, who committed suicide in Mayerling and in 1898 her mother was murdered. In 1916 Frans Joseph finally died.

In 1924, lymphoma, a specific type of cancer, was found in her. The doctors could no longer help her and on 6 September of that year she died in Wallsee-Sindelburg. She was buried in a grave behind the main altar of the local parish church.
